title: Potato Coins (Kartoffel Thaler Vier Jahresziten)
ingredients: 2 russet (baking) potatoes, about ½ pound each, well scrubbed, patted dry, and pricked
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
instructions: Bake the potatoes in the middle of a preheated oven set at 400º F. for 1 hour, or until they test soft when pricked with a toothpick.

When the potatoes are cool enough to handle cut them in half a scoop them out, discarding the skins.  Force the potato pulp through a ricer sot over a bowl.  In another bowl combine well 1 cup, firmly packed, of the potato pulp, reserving the remaining pulp for another use, with 1 tablespoon of the butter, softened, the egg yolk, and the salt.  Knead the mixture with floured hands on a lightly floured surface until it forms a smooth paste.  On the floured surface, using a rolling pin, roll out the paste ⅓ inch thick and, using a small 1½-inch round biscuit cutter, cut the paste into rounds.

In a large heavy skillet heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over moderately high heat until the foam subsides and in it sauté the potato rounds in batches, turning them, until both sides are golden brown.
Source:  New Year’s in  by Lillian Langseth-Christensen, Gourmet Magazine, January 1989.
